page.title: 20Ingleton Community Assoc.
page.content: A few years ago when villagers heard the{Jubilee Hall}would have to close as the{W.I}could no longer afford the upkeep, they decided to form an association to buy the hall. The{Hall}needed much renovation as it had been bought in 1935 from Darlington Greenbank Hospital and erected and opened on King George V and Queen Mary's{Jubilee. { }Today the hall is much brighter, warmer and more comfortable. There is a thriving{Youth Club}; the Camera, Art and Wine Clubs meet here and the W.I. There is also a popular Wednesday Club and Mother and toddler group. On the south side of the village is the cricket field , which has pleasant views of the Richmond Hills. The old cricket field was behind the village's only pub.Stuart Gamack, from Hilton, captains the team of local players.
